subject: And Then There Was One
event:
I could tell you the latest casting news, but really, the big guy should do that.

The grey man once had groupies.  Yes, girls.  Who?

The horse is saddled and bridled, but the rider has not yet appeared.

comments.article:
My first thought is that Maester Luwin's going to be played by Mick Jagger, once again returning to film and television...

... but then I noticed the past tense "had", and I'm pretty sure Mick still has groupies.
My first thought was Paul McCartney.  Surely anyone who *had* groupies probably still *has* a few?
i'll just wait for everyone else to do the work. im tortured enough just waiting to dance.
So Hodor has been cast, but not Bran...
comments.subject: Hodor!

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: DW 12 HoRS River
comments.article: Bran's been cast. And confirmed by Maureen Ryan after people at Winter-is-Coming figured it out a few days ago.
comments.subject: Re: Hodor!

comments.article: Henry Rollins?
Ian mackaye, probably.
awww drogo! get like... vin diesel or something. :D

I think Bran has been confirmed in the Chicago Tribune.
http://featuresblogs.chicagotribune.com/entertainment_tv/2009/10/game-of-thrones-hbo.html

I have to say, when you get this cryptic, it reminds me of some of the things my friends and I used to say in college when joking about secret spy code phrases.

"The parrot squwaks at midnight!"
Ummmm....I don't know.  Sounds like Gregor to me, but I've lost track of who's been cast and who hasn't.  Big guy, horse, etc.  If it is...I'm really curious.
Gregor's not in the pilot. I strongly suspect George is talking about Khal Drogo.
Could it be Meatloaf as Hodor?  I'm sure he  had groupies and was on a  BBC music show  called  the Old Grey Whistle Test.
Billy Nighy played a decaying rock star in Love Actually. With groupies and all? Plus hes all old and gray? Though he is neither big nor can I imagine who hed play anymore? Bah, I don't know!
The Meat is too old to play Hodor
comments.subject: Hodor

comments.article: Conan Stevens as the Mountain that Rides? :)

My first thought was Christopher Eccleston - pretty much because of the 'Who?' comment (he was Doctor Who) and the 'rider' stuff (he was the Rider in the appalling adaptation of Susan Cooper's Darl is Rising ... he was the saving grace of the film!).
I've always pictured the Dothraki to be somewhat Mongolian. After I saw Mongol, my dream actor for Drogo has been Japanese actor Tadanobu Asano.
Are you reading my thoughts? Because that was my exact thought for Drogo, too.

The minds over at WiC Blog have done it again.

Ian McNeice is Illyrio Mopatis.
(He's a big man, and he delivered the news on ROME.)

Donald Sumpter is Maester Luwin.
(He was in episodes of Dr. Who, and in a film called Groupie Girl.)

Khal Drogo is not yet cast.
(Since Morocco shoot will be a couple weeks later, they are still not required to have him cast by the time principle photography begins in Belfast.)

That's all I got.

...ryan
comments.subject: WiC Does It Again...

comments.article: Pretty sure GRRM said Hodor's not in the pilot.  I don't see many guesses on this one.  Have to check back after work to see.

If it is, take mercy on me and the others. That way I can stop going out every other evening and running with 60lbs on my back. My knees and back will be forever in your debt.

http://xenophon.page.tl/
comments.subject: Please don't let it be Hodor.

comments.article:
Hi. :) This is my first actual post in years of checking up on your site/blog. I've been eagerly watching the announcements on what roles have been cast, and while I didn't have too many I've wanted to share (aside from wishing Miranda Richardson was about 20 years younger, she is Cersei in my mind's eye), I finally have to say something about Gregor Clegane. So, I get you're in to football, but how about MMA? It's picking up quite a little following and there are a lot of big monsters that step into the ring/cage and the one who stands out to me as Gregor is Brock Lesnar. Yes, formerly of WWE fame (blegh), but if you've ever seen him fight (for real, not those staged shenanigans), he's a beast of a person. He probably can't act for shit, but here's a youtube clip of him training for an upcoming fight (go Carwin!) complete with drama music. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7wIM9bww0w&feature=player_embedded

Alas, he's only 6'3", but he *cuts weight* in order to get to 265 for fight time, and his hands are so big they special make his gloves. Anyway, good luck on your knots and don't sweat making your novels smaller! I *love* *love* *love* reading your books and never really want them to end, so coming in at 1200+ pages is totally fine by me and probably the rest of your fans. :D
Having a Mountain who is three inches shorter than our Hound might be a problem.

comments.subject: Too short to be the Mountain?

comments.article: I'm guessing Christopher Eccleston of Dr. Who fame, who played The Rider in the movie The Dark is Rising: The Seeker (a movie which everyone would do well to avoid if they'd rather not have their memories of a favorite fantasy novel desecrated).
I like the cut of your jib, my friend! :)
Morgan Van Dericho is Khal Drogo??  WOOO HOOO!!!!

On westeros there was a poll and among the choices there was this

Dalip "The Great Khali" Singh

who would fit very well the description of Drogo.

Look at this: http://www.flickr.com/photos/cuonghocap/sets/72157602120877230/

the last couple nights i managed to get the bbc series robin hood downloaded and started watching it. Keith Allen would be a perfect tywin I think, just thought i would make sure this guy has been seen =).

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0020717/
comments.subject: quick casting thought

comments.article: He's Alfie Allen's  father, so at least one person on AGoT definitely knows about him :)
comments.subject: Re: quick casting thought

comments.article:
*THE* perfect Tywin would undoubtedly be Clint Eastwood, but his honorary would certainly exceed any TV series budget.

I have found a guy who would be a good Sir Ilyn Payne.
He's italian and doesn't seem very... not very... smart :D

But Ilyn doesn't have to say much, does he? HAHA...

Take a look at his ugly mug but don't be scared (that's nearly exactly how I imagine him while reading the books):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xclLhZs22H8

BTW: at some point he states that he tried to work for the italian TV, but they didn't appreciate his outlook.
Brother, that's almost exactly how I pictured Ilyn Paine in my head. Where did you dig up this guy, for crying out loud?

comments.subject: Clint as Tywin?  Never thought of that

comments.article: I think its Roger Daltrey as Littlefinger.
I've always pictured Khal Drogo as the Rock (Dwayne Johnson). He's HUGE, buff, and perfectly complected for the part.

I like the clue thing, it is fun to specualte!!

not unlike Football, Why is it 4 downs? When Canadians only need 3!

has it got to do with Farehite and Celcious?
